New Records: David Fry hit the second pinch-homer in Cleveland postseason history
Key Match Events: Pinch-hitter David Fry had a go-ahead, two-run homer in the seventh inning
Emmanuel Clase retired five batters, preserving a 4-3 lead in the eighth
Justyn-Henry Malloy doubled leading off the ninth, advanced on Parker Meadows' groundout and scored on Jace Jung's groundout
Post-Match Reflections: The Tigers overcame a 2-1 deficit when Zach McKinstry homered in the fifth and Wenceel PÃ©rez hit a run-scoring single in the sixth
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Guardians ended a streak of 11 losses in postseason elimination games dating to Game 6 of 1997 World Series
The winner advances to the ALCS against the New York Yankees starting Monday
Others: Game 5 is Saturday in Cleveland, with ace Tarik Skubal set to start for the Tigers
